messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Unschooling and Video Games
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/22/02 4:48:36 PM, HEM-Editor@home-ed-magazine.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/22/02 4:48:36 PM, HEM-Editor@... writes:

<< Has anyone done anything along these lines for unschooling and
movies? Our kids swear they were "movieschooled" as much as
unschooled... <g> >>

I had an edited chat in the library at AOL about movies once, I think. Or
maybe it was chats on particular movies. Maybe that was it.

I'd love to write about movies but if someone else does it first that's fine.

Sandra

messages.subject: Unschooling and Video Games
messages.msgSnippet: ... Be sure to keep in touch on this, as if Kim accepts Mary s article we ll want to run a sidebar on relevant resources! Has anyone done anything along these
messages.messageBody:
At 12:08 AM +0000 8/22/02, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com wrote:
><< Anyway, I thought it was kinda cute on the benefits of
>unschooling and video games. I'd be happy to send you a copy. If it sucks,
>you can just ditch it. >>
>
>I wish you would send it so it could be put on a website even if HEM
>publishes it. Dan Vilter is thinking about doing a webpage with notes and
>links, and if he ends up deciding against that I'll do it myself!

Be sure to keep in touch on this, as if Kim accepts Mary's article
we'll want to run a sidebar on relevant resources!

Has anyone done anything along these lines for unschooling and
movies? Our kids swear they were "movieschooled" as much as
unschooled... <g>

Helen
